sub_title: Assistant Professor, Mathematical Institute, Utrecht University
summary:
I am currently an Assistant Professor in the Mathematical Institute at Utrecht University. Prior to that, I served as a Postdoc within the Chair of Mathematics for Uncertainty Quantification at RWTH Aachen University in Germany, from 2020 to 2023.  I obtained my PhD in Applied Mathematics and Computational Science in 2020 from KAUST.

My scientific expertise blends numerical analysis, mathematical (stochastic) modeling, and the design and implementation of computational simulation methods. I focus on numerical analysis to develop and analyze efficient and robust numerical methods for solving problems  in engineering and sciences that  involve stochastic models and stochastic differential equations.   My  research is driven by applications from areas such as  quantitative finance (where I work on efficient pricing of financial derivatives),  stochastic biological and chemical systems (with a focus on reliable estimation of statistical quantities, including rare events), and more recently, the modeling of hybrid  energy power systems (including renewables), and developing efficient numerical methods for the optimal management of these systems, and the design of optimal trading strategies in energy markets.

The developed methods in my research are based on a variety of techniques:   Monte Carlo (MC), multilevel MC, Quasi-MC, (adaptive) sparse grids' quadrature, Fourier methods, stochastic optimal control, importance sampling, and polynomial chaos expansion.

-My research portfolio: https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Chiheb-Ben-Hammouda

-My google scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Rc9hb2cAAAAJ&hl=en

-Homepage: https://www.uu.nl/staff/BHChiheb

projects.title: Portfolio optimization under Markowitz framework.
projects.description: In this project, we consider the problem of finding the optimal weights associated with the mean-variance portfolio optimization model introduced by Markowitz. The choice of an optimal portfolio of assets has been a topic of major interest in Finance. The basic idea is to maximize a utility function subject to a number of constraints on the investor risk function. In our work, we derived the expression of the optimization problem for a portfolio of N risky assets. Also, we presented 2 methods to solve this optimization problem using KKT conditions as well as the interior point method.

projects.title: Organization of the Study Trip to Turkey (2013)
projects.description:
This is a program included in our curriculum and its aim is to discover the economy of an industrialized country by visiting some companies there and also get in touch with a new culture. 

We were elected as the organizing committee of this Trip. Our main tasks were: 
1- Raising money for the expenses of this trip. 
2- Given the budget that we had, we tried first to choose a suitable destination then planning a 10 days program. 
3- Taking Care of the trip logistics.

projects.title: Stationarity and error correction model in time series
projects.description:
The aim of this project was to determine the cause-effect relationship between the energy consumption and the GDP in Tunisia in the sense of Granger. The methodology consists in 4 steps:
 (1) Stationarity test to see if there is cointegration or not.
 (2) Johansen test to determine the number of cointegration relations.
 (3) Estimation of the error correction model and identification of the causality relations.
 (4) Robustness test for the model. In this study, we used the Eviews software. 

We concluded that:
- On the short term, we find that the energy consumption affects the GDP of the country. 
- On the long term, we discovered that there is a bidirectional effect between the 2 quantities of interest.

projects.title: Achievement of a marketing Research for the development of a new hotel.
projects.description:
The main tasks where:

 1- Analyzing the external environment by performing:
 i) PESTEL analysis.
 ii) Demand Analysis. 
iii) Supply Analysis. 

2- Preparing a survey questions in order to estimate the potential demand and provide more details about the environment.

 3- Establishing the marketing strategy through:
 i) Market segmentation.
 ii) Targeting and positioning.

 4- Mix Marketing.

publications.name: Numerical Methods For Uncertainty Quantification In Option Pricing

authors.headline: Assistant Professor, Mathematical Institute, Utrecht University

profile_positions.description:
Researcher within the chair of mathematics for uncertainty quantification.
● Main research interests: Efficient numerical methods for option pricing and calibration, Fourier
option pricing in high dimensions, stochastic optimal control for renewable energy, estimation techniques based on Monte Carlo methods, importance sampling, and optimal control for biological/chemical systems.
● Co-Instructor of courses:
o Numerical Methods for Stochastic Differential Equations with Connections to Machine Learning.
o Stochastic Numerics with Applications in Simulation and Data Science.
o Numerical methods for random partial differential equations: hierarchical approximation and
machine learning approaches
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Research Scientist

company.name: King Abdullah University of Science and Technology

profile_positions.company: KAUST (King Abdullah University of Science and Technology)
profile_positions.description:
Ph.D. thesis title: "Hierarchical Approximation Methods for Option Pricing and Stochastic Reaction Networks"
Ph.D. topic: Design of novel hierarchical approximation methods for option pricing and stochastic biological/chemical systems, based on adaptive sparse grids, Monte Carlo, Multilevel Monte Carlo, importance sampling, Fourier techniques, and deep learning techniques.

Main achievements during my Ph.D.:
1- Manuscripts and Publications:
• Bayer, Christian, Chiheb Ben Hammouda, and Raúl Tempone. "Hierarchical adaptive sparse grids and quasi-Monte Carlo for option pricing under the rough Bergomi model." Quantitative Finance (2020): 1-17.
• Hammouda, C.B., Rached, N.B., and Tempone, R. (2019). Importance sampling for a robust and efficient Multilevel Monte Carlo estimator for stochastic reaction networks. To appear in Statistics and Computing Journal (2020), preprint: arXiv:1911.06286.
• Hammouda, C.B., Moraes, A., and Tempone, R. (2017). Multilevel hybrid split-step implicit tau-leap for
stochastic reaction networks, Numerical Algorithms, 74(2):527-560.
• Bayer, C., Hammouda, C.B., and Tempone, R. (2019). Numerical smoothing and hierarchical approximations for efficient option pricing and density estimation. arXiv preprint: arXiv:2003.05708.

2- Prize: Best poster award of SIAM Conference on Financial Mathematics (FM19), Toronto, Canada, 2019.

3- Co-supervised two Bachelor and one Master theses:
    Title 1: Statistical and Numerical Analysis of Rough Volatility Models
    Title 2: Efficient Option Pricing Using Fourier Techniques.
    Title 3: Importance Sampling for Pure Jump Processes.

profile_positions.description:
Participation in the project"Study of investment patterns of the Electricity Company of Burkina Faso (SONABEL) and tariff implications,World Bank financing."
This project includes:
-Forecast for medium and long-term of electricity demand in Burkina Faso.
-Techno-economic comparison of options (hydro, thermal, interconnections national and sub-regional energy projects envisaged in the sub-region, etc.) for the electricity supply in Burkina Faso for medium and long-term.
